DOC.HEAD: Six Killed Taking Body to Crematory
DOC.TEXT: Six people taking a body to a crematory were killed when their ambulance collided with a bus on a western Indian highway, a news agency reported Saturday. United News of India said Ramchandra Nilage, his wife, their two children and a friend were killed instantly in the accident Friday night. The ambulance driver died later at a hospital near the accident site in Maharashtra state's Bhelapada village, 700 miles southwest of New Delhi, UNI said. It said 12 passengers of the bus, operated by the Maharashtra state transport company, were injured. Another friend traveling with the Nilages was seriously injured, the news agency said.
